p: 3. We have a “pre-ontological” understanding of our ex-sistence. We will reserve the proper sense of the term “ontology” for the theoretical science of the meaning of things. When we say that ex-sistence is onto-logical [i.e., that we understanding being], we are referring not to the science of being but to our pre-scientific [pre-ontological, pre-theoretical] lived understanding of being. “Pre-ontological” is not the same as “ontic”—that is, our understanding is not confined to things—but instead indicates that our way of being consists in understanding both our way of being and the being of everything else.
